1.text: Call, I pray thee! Is there any that answereth thee? and to which of the holy ones wilt thou turn?

2.text: For vexation killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the simple.

3.text: I myself saw the foolish taking root, but suddenly I cursed his habitation.

4.text: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, and there is no deliverer:

5.text: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh even out of the thorns; and the snare gapeth for his substance.

6.text: For evil cometh not forth from the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;

7.text: For man is born to trouble, as the sparks fly upwards.

8.text: But as for me I will seek unto God, and unto God commit my cause;

9.text: Who doeth great things and unsearchable, marvellous things without number;

10.text: Who giveth rain on the face of the earth, and sendeth waters on the face of the fields;

11.text: Setting up on high those that are low; and mourners are exalted to prosperity.

12.text: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, and their hands carry not out the enterprise.

13.text: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness; and the counsel of the wily is carried headlong:

14.text: They meet with darkness in a the daytime, and grope at midday as in the night.

15.text: And he saveth the needy from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.

16.text: So the poor hath what he hopeth for, and unrighteousness stoppeth her mouth.

17.text: Behold, happy is the man whom +God correcteth; therefore despise not the chastening of the Almighty.

18.text: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up; he woundeth, and his hands make whole.

19.text: He will deliver thee in six troubles, and in seven there shall no evil touch thee.

20.text: In famine he will redeem thee from death, and in war from the power of the sword.

21.text: Thou shalt be hidden from the scourge of the tongue; and thou shalt not be afraid of destruction when it cometh.

22.text: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh, and of the beasts of the earth thou shalt not be afraid.

23.text: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field, and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.

24.text: And thou shalt know that thy tent is in peace; and thou wilt survey thy fold, and miss nothing.

25.text: And thou shalt know that thy seed is numerous, and thine offspring as the herb of the earth.

26.text: Thou shalt come to the grave in a ripe age, as a shock of corn is brought in in its season.

27.text: Behold this, we have searched it out, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thyself.
